channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Uneven Pavement, footpath., 3rd January
item.description:
Pavement tiles Are lifting up? I'm creating a dangerous surface. People walking, I have identified protestant tripping over and just couple weeks ago. Before Christmas, a bus driver fall down just as a bus was Approaching the whatsapp telford avenue. This is very dangerous and they need to be looked into asap.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Streatham Hill, Streatham Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees on Bohun Grove pavements, 3rd January
item.description:
The council have cut down a number of street trees on Bohun Grove but have not replaced them. I think there is now only one tree on the bottom half of Bohun Grove when there used to be about 10! Please replant some. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Bohun Grove, East Barnet, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Icy pavement, 3rd January
item.description:
No grit to be able to deice it. I can be a snow champion and help keep the pathways safe as its a small close with parking on one side. And older people here there is only 10 houses
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stiles Close, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Build up of litter, 3rd January
item.description:
Bohun Grove, Eton Ave and surrounding streets are looking very dirty. I often go out and do a litter pick but the streets are now in need of a deep clean.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Bohun Grove, East Barnet, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Solid ice on road, 3rd January
item.description:
The road desperately needs gritting is thick solid ice. I saw the refuge crew slipping all over the place collecting the waste this morning. One of them said he will request for it to be gritted. There will be an accident because it’s so near to the junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 183, Goodhart Way, Park Langley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stealing, 3rd January
item.description:
Person takeing charity clothes from recycling bins. It's robbery. Driver van reg is SC24ANU. Saw today 03.01.2026 at 05:41. Please Bromley take action. Also person left the floor in a big mess throwing clothes about.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mickleham Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London

item.title: Extremely dangerous black ice along the whole roads, 2nd January
item.description:
Along northfield avenue and bournewood Road there is extremely dangerous black ice on roads and pavements. These are busy back roads which need to be gritted by the morning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haydens Close, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flickering street lights from the grass side, 2nd January
item.description:
This is causing alot of issues whilst driving and also with anyone who is sensitive to flashing lights. The solar street lights are flickering from the start of the road till the end after sunset and it's from the grass side of the road. Can Peabody or Greenwich council please investigate and fix asap to avoid car accidents due to flashing lights
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goldfinch Road, Plumstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus stop lights not working, 2nd January
item.description:
In thomes lane se6 4RQ bus stop Q as no lights on working on it this as been reported before to TFL but they didn’t hover to come and repair it can you get in touch with TFL and let them know about this TFL are getting lazy all the money they’re getting from the public to go into London is a con for the public
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Nelgarde Road, Ladywell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus stop no lights, 2nd January
item.description:
On Bromley road br1 4JU bus stop DC as no lights on it working it’s dangerous at night you can’t see who is coming up towards the bus stop when waiting for a bus you have to use your phone light so the driver can see you at the bus stop can you tell TFL that they need to repair this as been going on like this for four years TFL are starting to get lazy saying they don’t have the money all that money they’re getting from the public
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 94, Bromley Hill, Downham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gritting required, 2nd January
item.description:
Due to the snow the top of bluston parade and on to the footbridge is very slippery. There have been falls. This area is extra busy as the station Bridge is out of use. Please grit asap before someone breaks something.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 215-217, Petts Wood Road, Poverest, Orpington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urine in the lift!, 2nd January
item.description:
This is so disappointing and disturbing, greater care must be taken of council homes, in not sure if I live in a building full of HUMANS or ANIMALS?, there is consistently something always wrong with council flats, PLEASE take greater security!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Arden Estate, Hackney, London
